intro: Antinisa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with a rosette of leaves that help retain moisture. Antinisa prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
